title.title: London Buses announces changes to bus routes 8, N8 and C2

texts: From Saturday 27 June 2009, bus route C2 will be extended to serve Victoria and routes 8 and N8 will terminate at Oxford Circus.
These changes will help to provide a more reliable service
The extension to route C2, which will run 24-hours-a-day between Parliament Hill Fields and Victoria, creates new direct links between Camden Town, Berkeley Square and Green Park.
At the same time route 8, which runs between Bow and Victoria, and route N8 which runs between Hainault and Victoria, will terminate at Oxford Circus and no longer serve Victoria.
Passengers wishing to continue their journeys from Oxford Circus will be able to use routes C2 or 73.
These changes will help improve reliability on route 8 and follow a detailed review of bus services in the area.
They will also contribute to a reduction in the number of buses using Oxford Street.
John Barry, Head of Network Development for London Buses, said: 'We keep the bus network under regular review.
'These changes will help to provide a more reliable service on route 8, and will provide new links between Camden Town, Berkeley Square and Green Park on route C2.'
To allow buses on route C2 to pick up passengers at Victoria bus station, route 52 will be adjusted to terminate at nearby Terminus Place, and pick up passengers in Wilton Road.
